availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Mary "Polly" N. Thurmond (Crittenden County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Crittenden County, Kentucky, farmerr. Virginia native. Mother of Philip Thurmond, James Livingston Thurmond, and Napoleon Bonaparte Thurmond. Resident of Crittenden County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons Crittenden County in 1850. Farmer in Crittenden County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 2, p. 258A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 2, p. 359.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 1, p. 466.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Crittenden County Administration Bonds, 1830-1869; Vol 1-4, 1865-1977, p. 153 of microfilm (Accessed via Ancestry.com on April 3, 2020).
KYR-0001-004-0322.
